comments:
Build 20030129

In my workspace, I installed a feature (the EditorList plug-in) from an
update site. I apparently installed it in the default location, inside the
host eclipse install. I later deleted my host eclipse install and upgraded
to a new version.

I'm now launching the new version of Eclipse (minus the feature) on the old
workspace (which still thinks it knows about the feature). When I go to the
install/update perspective, the site bookmark is still there, but when I
click on one of the leaf nodes for the site (a node corresponding to a
version of the plug-in), the preview editor opens, but the following 
exception occurs. The "Install" button appears in the Preview pane with no
text. Clicking the button launches the install wizard, but the wizard blows
up when I click Finish.

!SESSION Feb 03, 2003 10:35:43.168 ---------------------------------------------
java.version=1.4.1_01
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=linux, ARCH=x86, WS=gtk, NL=en_US
Command-line arguments: -os linux -ws gtk -arch x86 -debug -data /home/jburns/target -install file:/home/jburns/host/eclipse/
!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui.workbench 4 2 Feb 03, 2003 10:35:43.169
!MESSAGE Problems occurred when invoking code from plug-in: "org.eclipse.ui.workbench".
!STACK 0

It turns out that this bug isn't as specific as this report suggests.
Install/Update is "totally busted" as I describe more accurately in Bug 31391.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 31391 ***
